intro: Nemesia melissifolia, commonly known as lemon scented nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and profuse displays of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces a fragrant, lemon-scented foliage that is both ornamental and aromatic. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for hanging baskets and rock gardens. Its ability to bloom throughout the growing season adds continuous color to gardens.
